description: Number of ways to place non-intersecting diagonals in convex n-gon so as to create no triangles.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=2..200
D. Birmajer, J. B. Gil, M. D. Weiner, Colored partitions of a convex polygon by noncrossing diagonals, arXiv preprint arXiv:1503.05242 [math.CO], 2015.
INRIA Algorithms Project, Encyclopedia of Combinatorial Structures 93
S. Morrison, E. Peters, N. Snyder, Categories generated by a trivalent vertex, arXiv preprint arXiv:1501.06869 [math.QA], 2015.
L. Smiley, Variants of Schroeder Dissections, arXiv:math/9907057 [math.CO], 1999.
example: a(4)=a(5)=1 because of null placement; a(6)=4 because in addition to not placing any, we might also place one between any of the 3 pairs of opposite vertices.
mathematica: a[2]=1; a[n_] := Sum[Binomial[n+k-2, k]*Binomial[n-k-3, k-1], {k, 0, Floor[n/2]-1}]/(n-1);x*InverseSeries[Series[(y-y^2-y^3)/(1-y), {y, 0, 29}], x]
author: _Len Smiley_
